title: Music-KG-Project
description: The Music-KG-Project is a comprehensive initiative that constructs a knowledge graph centered on music sampling, integrating data from various sources to map relationships between artists, tracks, and samples. It features a Neo4j database for efficient data storage and retrieval, along with a Streamlit application for interactive exploration of the knowledge graph.

title: CascaProject
description: The Casca Project is designed to assess loan eligibility by analyzing financial documents, such as bank statements, using OpenAI's GPT-4 model. It converts PDFs into images, organizes them systematically, and employs a tailored prompt to extract and evaluate relevant financial data.

title: SetupForge
description: SetupForge is a Windows desktop application developed in C++ using wxWidgets, designed to automate software installation and system configuration tasks. It enables users to create, edit, and execute custom installation scripts for operations such as running executables, managing files and directories, setting environment variables, editing the registry, and mapping network drives.

title: cs566-project
description: SegOne is a channel-wise 1D convolutional U-Net designed for efficient and accurate segmentation tasks. The project includes a comprehensive implementation with training scripts, evaluation tools, and detailed documentation.

title: E-DataSync-Distributed-E-Commerce-Inventory-Management
description: E-DataSync is a distributed e-commerce inventory management system that integrates backend database management with a user-friendly frontend interface, facilitating efficient inventory tracking and management.

title: pe-consensus-scoring
description: The PE Consensus Scoring project implements algorithms for consensus and scoring, deployed on AWS Lambda, to facilitate efficient processing of tasks such as consensus requests and article publishing.

title: software-dev
description: The software-dev repository contains prototype files developed by the Public Editor Software Development Team, including components like web scrapers, Chrome extensions, and mobile applications. ([github.com](https://github.com/Goodly/software-dev?utm_source=openai))

title: 2022-wi-stats21
description: The repository at [https://github.com/chrisapton/2022-wi-stats21](https://github.com/chrisapton/2022-wi-stats21) contains course materials for an Introduction to Statistical Methods class, including lecture notes, assignments, and code examples.

title: CalHackss
description: The CalHackss repository contains a portion of the code developed during the CalHacks hackathon. Due to GitHub's storage limitations, the full codebase isn't uploaded.

title: chrisapton.github.io
description: The repository at [chrisapton.github.io](https://github.com/chrisapton/chrisapton.github.io) contains the source code for my personal website, including HTML, CSS, JavaScript files, and assets like images and PDFs.

title: Coding_Assessment_2024
description: The Applicant Compatibility Scoring System is a Python script that evaluates candidates for a technical team by calculating compatibility scores based on attributes such as intelligence, strength, endurance, and spicy food tolerance. It utilizes NumPy and pandas for data processing and requires an input JSON file named `input.json` to operate.

title: Heart-Disease-Prediction
description: The Heart Disease Prediction project involves analyzing heart disease data using R to develop predictive models. It includes R Markdown files detailing the analysis process, datasets for training and testing, and a PDF summarizing the findings.

title: MITHacks
description: Enlighten Me is a web application that facilitates real-time debates on controversial topics. Built with a Python Flask backend and a frontend utilizing HTML, CSS, JavaScript, and React, it presents users with a "Change My Mind" image featuring a contentious statement. Participants engage in a five-minute discussion before the topic refreshes, clearing the chat for a new conversation.

title: projects
description: The GitHub repository at [https://github.com/chrisapton/projects](https://github.com/chrisapton/projects) currently contains a `README.md` file and a `hello.txt` file. However, it lacks a detailed description or additional content.

title: round_robin
description: The "round_robin" repository contains the source code for the Encore Round Robin website, including HTML, CSS, and image files. The site is accessible at [roundrobinstore.com](https://roundrobinstore.com).

title: STATS-199-Research-SPR-2023
description: The STATS-199-Research-SPR-2023 repository contains materials from a research project conducted during the Spring 2023 semester. It includes Jupyter notebooks (`STATS_199_1.ipynb`, `STATS_199_ARIMAX.ipynb`), a final project report (`STATS_199_Final_Project.pdf`), code documentation (`STATS_199_code.pdf`), and a submission file (`submission.csv`). These resources collectively document the project's methodology, analysis, and findings.
